units.title: Coat plates with Matrigel
units.text: Pre‑coat 24‑well plates with GFR Matrigel as described in Reagent setup. The coated plates can be wrapped in Paraﬁlm and kept for ≤2 weeks at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Establishes a sterile, extracellular matrix surface for PSC attachment.

units.title: Add accutase
units.text: Add 1 ml of accutase to the wells.
units.rationale: Enzymatically detaches PSC colonies for single‑cell suspension.

units.title: Incubate for dissociation
units.text: Incubate at 37 °C for 5 min, allowing PSC colonies to dissociate into single cells.
units.rationale: Facilitates complete cell dissociation without excessive exposure.

units.title: Centrifuge cells
units.text: Centrifuge the cells at 1,000 r.p.m. for 3 min at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Pellets cells while preserving viability at low temperature.

units.title: Plate PSCs at defined density
units.text: Plate the cells at a density of 100,000–150,000 cells/well in 500 μl of mTeSR1 including 10 μM Y‑27632 on a Matrigel‑coated tissue culture 24‑well plate.
units.rationale: Ensures uniform seeding for consistent colony formation.

units.title: Add day‑0 medium
units.text: Add 0.5 ml/well of day 0 medium to the 24‑well plate. Place the plate back in the incubator with 5 % CO₂ at 37 °C overnight.
units.rationale: Initiates definitive endoderm induction under controlled conditions.

units.title: Dilute TrypLE
units.text: Add 500 μl of warm DMEM/F12 to each well to sufficiently dilute the TrypLE.
units.rationale: Stops enzymatic activity and prepares cells for downstream handling.

units.title: Form gut spheroids
units.text: Plate the anterior or posterior gut cell suspensions in 96‑well round‑bottom ultra‑low attachment plates at a density of 10,000 cells with 100 μl day 7 medium per well and incubate at 37 °C overnight to form spheroids.
units.rationale: Promotes 3‑D aggregation of gut cells into uniform spheroids.

units.title: Create anterior‑posterior boundary
units.text: Transfer the posterior spheroid to a well containing one anterior spheroid in the same 96‑well round‑bottom ultra‑low attachment plate (Fig. 3b).
units.rationale: Allows fusion of opposite‑region spheroids to generate a boundary organoid.

units.title: Embed fused spheroids in Matrigel
units.text: 41 On day 9, embed A–P spheroids in Matrigel drops and culture in gut growth medium to generate multi‑organ HBPOs (Fig. 3c).
units.rationale: Provides a 3‑D matrix for further differentiation into multi‑organ HBPOs.
